net.vivialconnect.model.message

Class Attachment

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.vivialconnect.model.VivialConnectResource
      • net.vivialconnect.model.message.Attachment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Attachment
extends VivialConnectResource
    A MMS can contains attachments, which can be a media, text or any supported object by the API defined in the following link: https://dashboard.vivialconnect.net/docs/general/mms.html

    This class represents single message attachment and its properties.

    For more info about attachments visit: Attachments

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getAttachmentById

        public static Attachment getAttachmentById(int messageId,
                                           int attachmentId)
                                    throws VivialConnectException
        Search for a message attachment given an id.
        Parameters:
        messageId - the messageId that contains the attachment
        attachmentId - the media attachmentId
        Returns:
        the attachment found, or null if not found
        Throws:
        VivialConnectException - if there is an API-level error

      • count

        public static int count(int messageId)
                 throws VivialConnectException
        Total number of attachment sent in the specified text message. If there are none, this method will return 0
        Parameters:
        messageId - the messageId that contains the attachment
        Returns:
        number of attachment in message
        Throws:
        VivialConnectException - if there is an API-level error

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
               throws VivialConnectException
        Deletes this attachment from the database, dissociating it from the message.

        If the attachment you're trying to delete does not exist, a VivialConnectException holding a 404 response code will be thrown.

        Returns:
        a boolean value, indicating whether the attachment was deleted or not
        Throws:
        VivialConnectException - if there is an API-level error
